Define a new generic

Source: R/generic.R
new_generic.Rd

Use new_generic to define a new generic for a package. If you need to reference a generic in another package either import the generic into your package's namespace or use new_external_generic to declare it as an external generic and add a method_register() call to your .onLoad function.

new_generic(name, signature = NULL, fun = NULL)

new_external_generic(package, generic, version = NULL)

Arguments

name

The name or generic object of the generic
signature

The signature of the generic
fun

The function to use as the body of the generic.
package

The package the external generic is defined in.
generic

The name or generic object of the generic
version

An optional version the package must meet for the method to be registered.

Contents

Developed by Henrik Bengtsson, Will Landau, Michael Lawrence, Martin Maechler, Luke Tierney, Gabriela De Queiroz, Hadley Wickham, Jim Hester.
